data.title: Constance of Aragon
data.meta_description: Constance of Aragon was an Aragonese infanta who was by marriage firstly Queen of Hungary, and secondly Queen of Germany and Sicily and Holy Roman Empress. She was regent of Sicily from 1212 to 1220.
data.text:
Constance of Aragon (1179 â€“ 23 June 1222) was an Aragonese infanta who was by marriage firstly Queen of Hungary, and secondly Queen of Germany and Sicily and Holy Roman Empress. She was regent of Sicily from 1212 to 1220.

For other people named Constance of Aragon, see Constance of Aragon (disambiguation).
